newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai PM Chavalit to visit Brunei, Singapore.
newsitem.headline: Thai PM Chavalit to visit Brunei, Singapore.

text.p: Thai prime minister Chavalit Yongchaiyudh will pay a courtesy visit to Brunei and Singapore next week, Radio Thailand reported on Saturday.
Chavalit, who took office in December, will hold talks with his counterparts when he visits Brunei on March 19-20 and Singapore on March 20-21, the radio reported.

Singapore is Thailand's most important trading partner in the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) grouping with two-way trade amounting to 200-300 billion baht ($7.69-$11.54 billion) a year, the radio reported.
Thailand imports crude oil from Brunei while its main export to the country is rice. Two-way trade is about 7.0 billion baht a year.

"Prime Minister Chavalit will also ask the leaders to help look after Thai workers in the two countries," Radio Thailand said. There are currently 32,400 Thai workers in Brunei and 50,000 in Sinpapore, it said. ($1=26 baht)
